se.sics.tasim.tac03.aw

Class SCMAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.sics.tasim.aw.Agent
      • se.sics.tasim.tac03.aw.SCMAgent

  • public abstract class SCMAgent
extends Agent
    The abstract class SCMAgent extends Agent with support functionality for TAC SCM. SCMAgent provides the following features for the agent developer:
    • APIs for accessing game information.
    • Automatic bookkeeping of RFQs, orders, and inventory.
    • Support for creating production schedules based on inventory and capacity.
    • Provides an easier API for handling messages.

    • Field Summary

        Returns the last received bank status. The bank status is received each day before the simulation status.

      • getCurrentInventory

        protected InventoryStatus getCurrentInventory()
        Returns the last received inventory. The inventory is received each day before the simulation status.

      • getInventoryForNextDay

        protected InventoryStatus getInventoryForNextDay()
        Returns the calculated inventory for next day. The inventory for next day includes components that will be available next day (not in the this day's inventory) and also the products that are produced this day. It is used to bookkeep the production and deliveries for next day to ease the generation of delivery and production schedules.

        Returns the last received RFQs from the customers.

      • getCustomerOrders

        protected OrderStore getCustomerOrders()
        Returns the customer order store. Information about the active customer orders (not yet delivered) can be found in the customer order store.

      • addCustomerOffer

        protected int addCustomerOffer(RFQBundle rfqBundle,
                   int rfqIndex,
                   int offeredUnitPrice)
        Adds an offer to be sent to the customers in response to a RFQ.

        Note: to send the offers to the customers, the sendCustomerOffers method must be called after all offers been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        rfqBundle - the RFQ bundle from the customers
        rfqIndex - the index of the RFQ to bid on
        offeredUnitPrice - the offered price per unit
        Returns:
        the allocated offer ID
        See Also:
        sendCustomerOffers()

      • sendCustomerOffers

        protected void sendCustomerOffers()
        Sends any pending offers to the customers.

                 int productID,
                 int quantity,
                 int dueDate)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addSupplierRFQ(String,int,int,int,int)
        Adds a RFQ to be sent to the specified supplier.

        Note: to send the RFQs to the suppliers, the sendSupplierRFQs method must be called after all RFQs been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        supplierAddress - the address of the supplier
        productID - the requested component
        quantity - the requested quantity
        dueDate - the requested delivery date
        Returns:
        the allocated RFQ id
        See Also:
        addSupplierRFQ(String,int,int,int,int), sendSupplierRFQs()

      • addSupplierRFQ

        protected int addSupplierRFQ(java.lang.String supplierAddress,
                 int productID,
                 int quantity,
                 int reservePricePerUnit,
                 int dueDate)
        Adds a RFQ to be sent to the specified supplier.

        Note: to send the RFQs to the suppliers, the sendSupplierRFQs method must be called after all RFQs been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        supplierAddress - the address of the supplier
        productID - the requested component
        quantity - the requested quantity
        reservePricePerUnit - the reservation price or 0 for no price constraints
        dueDate - the requested delivery date
        Returns:
        the allocated RFQ id
        See Also:
        sendSupplierRFQs()

      • sendSupplierRFQs

        protected void sendSupplierRFQs()
        Sends any pending RFQs to the suppliers.

      • addSupplierOrder

        protected Order addSupplierOrder(java.lang.String supplierAddress,
                     OfferBundle offers,
                     int offerIndex)
        Adds an order to be sent to a supplier in response to an offer.

        Note: to send the orders to the suppliers, the sendSupplierOrders method must be called after all orders been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        supplierAddress - the supplier to order from
        offers - the offer bundle from the supplier
        offerIndex - the index of the offer in the bundle
        Returns:
        the new order
        See Also:
        sendSupplierOrders()

      • sendSupplierOrders

        protected void sendSupplierOrders()
        Sends any pending orders to the suppliers.

      • addDeliveryRequest

        protected boolean addDeliveryRequest(Order order)
        Adds a delivery request to the delivery schedule for next day if possible. This method is using the calculated inventory for next day to determine if the delivery can be made or not. If it can be made the delivered products are removed from the inventory status and the order is marked as delivered.

        Note: the sendFactorySchedules method must be used to send the delivery schedule to the factory after all deliveries have been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        order - the order to deliver for.
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to deliver the order and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        sendFactorySchedules()

      • addProductionRequest

        protected boolean addProductionRequest(int productID,
                           int quantity)
        Adds a production request to the production schedule for next day if possible. This method is using the calculated inventory for next day to determine if the production can be made or not. If it can be made the components used for the production are removed from the inventory status.

        Note: the sendFactorySchedules method must be used to send the production schedule to the factory after all production requests have been added. This must be done before the day ends!

        Parameters:
        productID - the product to produce
        quantity - the number of products to produce
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to produce the specified products and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        sendFactorySchedules()

      • sendFactorySchedules

        protected void sendFactorySchedules()
        Sends the delivery and production schedules to the manufacturer's factory.

      • sendAll

        protected void sendAll()
        Convenient method to make sure all offer, orders, delivery- and production schedules have been sent.

        protected abstract void simulationStarted()
        Called when the agent received all startup information and it is time to start participating in the simulation.

      • simulationEnded

        protected abstract void simulationEnded()
        Called when a game/simulation has ended and the agent should free its resources.

      • handleCustomerRFQs

        protected abstract void handleCustomerRFQs(RFQBundle rfqBundle)
        Called when a bundle of RFQs have been received from the customers. In TAC SCM the customers only send one bundle per day and the same RFQs are sent to all manufacturers.
        Parameters:
        rfqBundle - a bundle of RFQs

      • handleCustomerOrders

        protected abstract void handleCustomerOrders(Order[] newOrders)
        Called when a bundle of orders have been received from the customers. In TAC SCM the customers only send one order bundle per day as response to offers (and only if they want to order something).
        Parameters:
        newOrders - the new customer orders

      • handleSupplierOffers

        protected abstract void handleSupplierOffers(java.lang.String supplierAddress,
                        OfferBundle offers)
        Called when a bundle of offers have been received from a supplier. In TAC SCM suppliers only send on offer bundle per day in reply to RFQs (and only if they had something to offer).
        Parameters:
        supplierAddress - the supplier that sent the offers
        offers - a bundle of offers

      • handleSupplierDelivery

        protected void handleSupplierDelivery(DeliveryNotice notice)
        Called when a delivery notice has been received from a supplier. In TAC SCM only the suppliers send delivery notices to manufacturers. A delivery notice contains the components that will be delivered during the day and these components will be available for production the next day. The supplier address can be determined with the getSupplier method in the delivery notice.
        Parameters:
        notice - a delivery notice with a list of components that are about to be delivered
        See Also:
        DeliveryNotice.getSupplier()

      • handleFactoryStatus

        protected void handleFactoryStatus(FactoryStatus status)
        Called each day when the factory status is received.
        Parameters:
        status - the latest factory status (factory utilization and inventory)

      • handleBankStatus

        protected void handleBankStatus(BankStatus status)
        Called each day when the bank status is received.
        Parameters:
        status - the latest bank status

      • handlePriceReport

        protected void handlePriceReport(PriceReport report)
        Called each day when the price report is received.
        Parameters:
        report - the price report for previous day

      • handleMarketReport

        protected void handleMarketReport(MarketReport report)
        Called when a market report is received.
        Parameters:
        report - the latest market report

      • handleSimulationStatus

        protected abstract void handleSimulationStatus(SimulationStatus status)
        Called when a simulation status has been received and that all messages from the server this day have been received. The next message will be for the next day.
        Parameters:
        status - a simulation status
